snippet: After putting the initial price tag for what it held to be an anti-Semitic episode in Santa Monica at $1.2 million, a jury began considering what could be a much higher punitive award.
abstract: Jury finds Tehmina Adaya, Muslim propietor of Santa Monica's Hotel Shangri-La, guilty of discrimination for trying to evict a Jewish group from her hotel in 2010; awards compensatory and punitive damages to the plaintiffs for the anti-Semitic episode.
lead_paragraph: After putting the initial price tag for what it held to be an anti-Semitic episode in Santa Monica at $1.2 million, a jury began considering what could be a much higher punitive award.

headline.seo: Compensation for Jews in Hotel Shangri-La Case
headline.main: Jews Awarded Damages in California Hotel Case
headline.print_headline: Jews Awarded Damages In California Hotel Case
